text:
- I've been using the iPhone
ever since it came out,
one of the biggest problems with it,
is there's no instruction manual.

Apple doesn't provide a
manual for the iPhone,
like you would get with a new TV or car,

a lot of those iPhone
features are super useful,
but also very hard to find,
they're buried in various settings menus,
or not mentioned anywhere at all.
I've been using and covering the iPhone,
since it launched in 2007.

And these are some of my
absolute favorite hidden tricks
My number one favorite trick,
getting rid of that ducking problem.
If you have a word you use often,

and the iPhone keeps autocorrecting
it to something else,
go to Settings, General,

scroll down to Keyboard
and Text Replacement,
tap the plus sign and

enter the word you want it
to remember in both fields.
You can also add shortcuts
for long phrases and email addresses.
The iPhone also makes it super easy to
share Wi-Fi passwords,

if a friends iPhone is
tryna get on your Wi-Fi
a pop-up will notify you,
and you can easily grant them access.

If you have a problem reaching
the keys with just one hand,
you can force press on this globe icon,

and move the keyboard
to the left or right.
When you're done just tap the arrow,
to move it back to the center.
You can create your own vibrations,
and assign them to any of your contacts.

Just go to Settings,
Sounds & Haptics, Ringtone,
Vibration, Create New Vibration.
Tap out a pattern and save it,
you can use it as your default vibration,
or just assign it to specific contacts.
Just go to the contact, select Edit,

Ringtone Or Text Tone,
and Change The Vibration.

You can make the flash blink
to signal new notifications,

just go to Settings,
General, Accessibility,

scroll down and enable
LED Flash for Alerts

Now, when you have stuff
coming in the flash will blink.

If you're tired of autocorrect
changing words, like,

We're to were and getting
rid of your apostrophe,

just type the last
letter of the word twice,
and the apostrophe will stay.

If you're using the
calculator and make a mistake,

just swipe to the left or
right in the number field,
and the last number will be deleted.
Speaking of math, if you just need to do
a simple and quick operation,
just swipe down into the search bar,
enter your operation,

and the search bar will
compute it for you.

One last awesome trick,
there's a hidden camera level,
perfect for overhead shots,

go to Settings, scroll down,
Camera, and enable the Grid.

When you hold your phone
directly over something

to take a photo, two
crosshairs will appear,

When you line them up, your
phone will be perfectly level,
and you should take your photo.

These are some of the best
and most useful tricks,
Apple is sure to add more,
we'll keep you updated when they do.
(light marimba music)
